paper.title: Reduced Labelled Transition Systems Save Verification Effort

author.org: Technical Research Centre of Finland Computer Technology Laboratory
Technical Research Centre of Finland Computer Technology Laboratory

paper.abstract: A new method for reducing the amount of effort in the verification of Basic Lotos specifications is presented. The method is based on generating a reduced labelled transition system (RLTS) of the specification. The RLTS captures the semantics of the specification in the sense of the semantic theory of CSP but it is typically much smaller than the ordinary labelled transition system (LTS) of the specification. Thus it can replace the LTS in the verification of the equivalence (in CSP sense) of two specifications. The method is demonstrated with a bounded buffer example where an exponential saving of states is achieved.
